items.title: Exercise 1: Legal Alert
items.text:
CONFIDENTIAL: Legal Alert regarding Project X

Our monitoring service has identified a new product from 'Apex Dynamics' that bears a striking resemblance to our Project X prototype. 

Given that our prototype was kept in a secure VDR, Apex Dynamics must have gained access through an external leak. It could be a simple case of corporate espionage, or a former employee might have shared technical specs. 

We must file our patent application immediately. If they file first, it could have devastating effects on our market position. It can't be a coincidence that their launch date aligns with our internal milestones.

questions.question: What is the primary concern mentioned in the alert?
questions.explanation: The alert discusses a competitor product that resembles a prototype and mentions corporate espionage.

questions.question: Which modal verb is used to express strong certainty about a past event?
questions.explanation: 'Must have + past participle' expresses high certainty (deduction) about the past.

items.prompt: Exercise 2: IP Terminology. Which of these protects a brand logo?
items.explanation: Trademarks are used to protect brand identifiers like logos and names.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Modals of Deduction (Past). Rewrite: 'I'm almost certain that they didn't see the contract.' -> 'They ____ (see) the contract.'
items.modelAnswer: They couldn't have seen the contract.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Modals of Deduction (Present). Rewrite: 'It's possible that this is a trademark violation.' -> 'This ____ (be) a trademark violation.'
items.modelAnswer: This could / might / may be a trademark violation.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: IP Chunks. To 'infringe on a copyright' means:
options: To buy the copyright from the owner
To break the legal rights of the copyright owner
To help someone protect their work
To write a book about copyrights
items.explanation: Infringement is the unauthorized use of protected IP.
